item.title: 油价因美国库存下降而上涨，委内瑞拉成为焦点
item.description: 周四油价小幅上涨，结束连续两日下跌走势。美国原油库存降幅超出预期，为投资者买入期货提供了动力，同时他们也在密切关注委内瑞拉局势发展。【原文：Oil prices gained slightly on Thursday, rebounding from two days of declines, as a larger-than-expected draw in U.S. crude inventories provided some impetus for investors to buy futures while they monitor developments in Venezuela.】

item.title: 美国豁免部分外国制造的无人机不受特朗普对新型无人机进口禁令的限制
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周三表示，将豁免部分外国制造的新款无人机及关键组件进口，使其不受去年12月实施的全面进口禁令限制。【原文：The U.S. Federal Communications Commission said on Wednesday it is exempting imports of some new models of foreign-made drones and critical components from a sweeping import ban adopted in December.】

item.title: 《金融时报》报道称，中国黑客入侵了美国国会委员会工作人员的电子邮件系统
item.description: 据《金融时报》周三报道，知情人士透露，中国黑客入侵了美国众议院若干重要委员会工作人员使用的电子邮箱，此举是代号为"盐台风"的大规模网络间谍行动的一部分。【原文：China has hacked emails used by congressional staff on powerful committees in the U.S. House of Representatives, as part of a massive cyber espionage campaign known as Salt Typhoon, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据《The Information》报道，OpenAI为员工股票期权池拨出500亿美元资金。
item.description: 据《信息》周三报道，知情人士透露，OpenAI去年秋季为员工股票期权池预留了相当于公司10%股权的额度，按10月份5000亿美元的估值计算。【原文：OpenAI last fall set aside an employee stock grant pool equivalent to 10% of the company, valued at $500 billion in October, The Information reported on Wednesday, citing two people with knowledge of the plans.】

item.title: 英国新规要求科技公司必须屏蔽未经请求的裸体图片
item.description: 根据将于周四生效的网络安全法规，英国科技公司将被要求屏蔽未经请求的色情图像。全球各国政府正加大力度遏制与人工智能相关的滥用行为及风险。【原文：Technology companies in Britain will be required to block unsolicited sexual images under online safety rules taking effect on Thursday, as governments worldwide step up efforts to curb abuse and risks linked to artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 福特将于2028年推出首款无需注视的驾驶辅助系统
item.description: 福特汽车周三表示，将于2028年推出三级驾驶辅助系统，该系统可在特定高速公路行驶时允许驾驶员将双手离开方向盘、视线移开道路。【原文：Ford Motor said on Wednesday it would bring Level 3 driver-assistance systems to market in 2028, allowing drivers to take their hands and eyes off the road while operating on certain highways.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利晋升184名员工为董事总经理，备忘录显示
item.description: 据路透社获得的一份内部备忘录显示，摩根士丹利今年晋升了184名员工为董事总经理，较去年同期增长约6%。【原文：Morgan Stanley promoted 184 of its employees to managing directors this year, an about 6% increase from a year ago, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国法官称马斯克就OpenAI转为营利性公司提起的诉讼可进入审判阶段
item.description: 亿万富翁企业家埃隆·马斯克周三说服法官，允许就其指控进行陪审团审判——他指控ChatGPT制造商OpenAI在备受瞩目的重组为营利性实体的过程中，违背了其创始使命。【原文：Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk persuaded a judge on Wednesday to allow a jury trial on his allegations that ChatGPT maker OpenAI violated its founding mission in its high-profile restructuring to a for-profit entity.】

item.title: 星座品牌公司第三季度业绩超预期，得益于莫德罗与科罗娜啤酒需求的稳定增长
item.description: 星座品牌公司周三公布的第三季度销售额和利润超出华尔街预期，这得益于其Modelo Especial和Corona啤酒品牌需求的持续稳定。【原文：Constellation Brands reported third-quarter sales and profit above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by steady demand for its Modelo Especial and Corona beer brands.】

item.title: 与特朗普有关联的世界自由金融公司申请设立信托银行牌照
item.description: 由唐纳德·特朗普总统家族支持的加密货币企业World Liberty Financial周三表示，其子公司已向美国银行业监管机构提交申请，拟设立一家专注于稳定币业务的全国性信托银行。【原文：World Liberty Financial, a crypto venture backed by the family of President Donald Trump, said on Wednesday that its subsidiary has filed an application with U.S. banking regulators to establish a national trust bank focused on stablecoin operations.】

item.title: 三星预计第四季度营业利润将翻三倍，创历史新高，主要得益于芯片短缺。
item.description: 三星电子周四预测，受供应紧张及人工智能驱动需求激增推动传统内存芯片价格上涨，其第四季度营业利润将较上年同期增长三倍，创历史新高。【原文：Samsung Electronics on Thursday projected a three-fold jump in fourth-quarter operating profit from a year earlier to a record high as tight supply and a surge in artificial intelligence-driven demand stoked prices for conventional memory chips.】

item.title: First Brands启动出售程序，计划退出破产保护程序
item.description: 汽车零部件供应商First Brands周三表示，该公司已启动整体或部分业务的营销和销售流程，以期摆脱第11章破产保护。【原文：Auto parts supplier First Brands said on Wednesday it has launched a marketing and sale process for its business as a whole or in parts, as it works to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy.】

item.title: 美国商务统计局表示，将采用9月和11月消费者物价指数（CPI）的平均值来计算10月个人消费支出（PCE）通胀率。
item.description: 美国经济分析局周三表示，将采用9月和11月消费者价格指数数据的平均值，来推算出美联储货币政策所追踪的通胀指标的10月预估值。【原文：The U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis said on Wednesday it would use an average of September and November Consumer Price Index data to produce October estimates for the inflation measures tracked by the Federal Reserve for monetary policy.】

item.title: 应用数字公司季度营收超预期，得益于人工智能数据中心需求，股价大涨
item.description: 应用数字公司周三公布的第二季度营收超出华尔街预期，这家数据中心运营商受益于市场对其大型人工智能工作负载设施的强劲需求。【原文：Applied Digital reported second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as the data center operator benefited from strong demand for its large-scale facilities for artificial intelligence workloads.】

item.title: 洛克希德公司表示，随着需求推动生产进度加快，2025年F-35战机交付量将达到191架。
item.description: 洛克希德·马丁公司周三表示，2025年向美国及其盟国交付了191架F-35战斗机，创下该项目交付量新高。【原文：Lockheed Martin said on Wednesday it delivered 191 F-35 fighter jets in 2025 to the United States and its allies, a record for the program.】

item.title: 交易日晴朗开局，阴郁收场
item.description: 周三，标普500指数和道琼斯工业平均指数一度攀升至新高，但受美国就业数据喜忧参半影响，最终收盘走低。与此同时，债券收益率、原油及金属价格也出现显著下跌。【原文：The S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrials climbed to new highs on Wednesday but closed the session lower in the wake of patchy U.S. employment data, while bond yields, oil, and metals prices also posted notable declines.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称雪佛龙正与美国政府商谈扩大委内瑞拉油田开采许可
item.description: 四位知情人士周三透露，石油生产商雪佛龙正与美国政府商谈扩大在委内瑞拉运营的关键许可证，以便增加向其自身炼油厂的原油出口，并向其他买家销售。【原文：Oil producer Chevron is in talks with the U.S government to expand a key license to operate in Venezuela so it can increase crude exports to its own refineries and sell to other buyers, four sources close to the negotiations said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 随着欺诈调查不断增加，First Brands公司现金告急
item.description: 破产的汽车零部件制造商First Brands可能在本月底前耗尽现金，其律师周三表示，该公司正寻求从贷款方获得额外资金，并推进短期资产出售，以争取更多时间重组业务。该企业长期受欺诈指控困扰。【原文：Bankrupt auto-parts maker First Brands could run out of cash by the end of the month, and it is seeking additional funding from its lenders and pursuing near-term asset sales in order to buy more time to restructure a business that has been plagued by fraud allegations, its attorneys said Wednesday.】

item.title: 印度监管机构发现美银在大宗交易前泄露机密信息，《华尔街日报》报道
item.description: 《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士报道称，印度市场监管机构发现美国银行不当披露了一笔1.8亿美元股票大宗交易的重大非公开信息，并就此误导了监管机构。【原文：India's markets regulator has found that Bank of America improperly shared material non-public information about a $180 million block trade of stock and misled the authorities about it, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通达成协议接管苹果信用卡业务，《华尔街日报》报道
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，摩根大通已与高盛达成协议，将接手苹果信用卡项目。该报道援引知情人士消息称。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has reached a deal to take over Apple credit-card program from Goldman Sachs , the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 礼来以12亿美元收购Ventyx，进军非重磅肥胖症药物领域
item.description: 礼来公司周三宣布，将以12亿美元现金收购自身免疫药物开发商Ventyx生物科学公司。作为泽普邦的制造商，此举标志着礼来公司最新一次拓展其畅销糖尿病和减肥药物以外业务的尝试。【原文：Eli Lilly will buy autoimmune drug developer Ventyx Biosciences for $1.2 billion in cash, the companies said on Wednesday, marking the Zepbound maker's latest push to expand beyond its blockbuster diabetes and weight-loss drugs.】

item.title: 杰富瑞利润因交易量回升和强劲承销业务而增长
item.description: 杰富瑞周三公布第四季度盈利增长，得益于交易业务反弹和承销业务强劲，这为投资者提供了华尔街投行业务强劲的早期信号。【原文：Jefferies reported higher fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, boosted by a rebound in dealmaking and strong underwriting, giving investors an early signal about the strength of Wall Street's investment-banking business.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁削减雷神公司政府合同，因其实施股票回购计划
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周三批评国防承包商雷神公司对美军需求反应迟缓，并威胁称若该公司不限制股票回购，将削减其政府合同。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump criticized defense contractor Raytheon on Wednesday for what he called the company's slow response to the demands of the U.S. military and threatened to cut its government contracts if the firm did not restrict stock buybacks.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚第四季度上游利润下滑
item.description: 美国石油巨头埃克森美孚周三表示，原油价格下跌可能使其第四季度上游业务盈利减少约8亿至12亿美元。【原文：U.S. oil major Exxon Mobil said on Wednesday that lower crude oil prices could cut its fourth-quarter upstream earnings by about $800 million to $1.2 billion.】

item.title: 康卡斯特电视业务剥离为派拉蒙在收购华纳兄弟的战役中提供了更多筹码
item.description: 派拉蒙天空舞影业在争取华纳兄弟探索公司股东支持的行动中获得了新助力——市场对康卡斯特剥离业务的反应，使其更有底气向股东证明：以1084亿美元收购这家历史悠久的好莱坞制片厂、HBO及探索频道的报价更为优越。【原文：Paramount Skydance gained fresh ammunition in its campaign to convince Warner Bros Discovery shareholders that its $108.4 billion bid for the storied Hollywood studio, HBO, and Discovery Channel is the better offer: the market's response to Comcast's spin-off.】

item.title: 彭博社报道，德国汉高公司对Olaplex提出收购意向
item.description: 据彭博社周三报道，知情人士透露，德国消费品制造商汉高已向Olaplex控股公司提出收购要约。【原文：Olaplex Holdings has drawn a takeover offer from Germany's consumer goods maker Henkel , Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: OpenAI推出ChatGPT Health，实现医疗记录与健康应用的互联互通
item.description: OpenAI于周三推出ChatGPT健康标签页，该功能可解答健康相关问题，并允许用户上传医疗记录，同时支持连接Apple Health和MyFitnessPal等健康应用。【原文：OpenAI on Wednesday launched a ChatGPT Health tab that answers health-related questions and lets users upload medical records and connect wellness apps such as Apple Health and MyFitnessPal.】

item.title: KeyCorp旗下子公司将支付777万美元以解决美国欺诈指控
item.description: 新泽西州联邦检察官办公室周三表示，KeyCorp旗下某部门将支付777万美元，以解决其涉嫌违反《联邦虚假索赔法》的指控——该部门曾提交薪资保护计划下的欺诈性贷款申请以获取债务豁免。【原文：A unit of KeyCorp will pay $7.77 million to resolve allegations it violated the federal False Claims Act by submitting fraudulent loans from the Paycheck Protection program for forgiveness, the U.S. Attorney's office in New Jersey said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，艾伯维正洽谈收购生物技术公司Revolution Medicines
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，知情人士透露，艾伯维正就收购抗癌药物开发商Revolution Medicines进行深入谈判。【原文：AbbVie is in advanced talks to buy cancer-drug developer Revolution Medicines , the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 谷歌与人工智能公司就佛罗里达州母亲因儿子自杀提起的诉讼达成和解
item.description: 据周三法庭文件显示，谷歌母公司Alphabet旗下谷歌公司与人工智能初创企业Character.AI已就一起诉讼达成和解。佛罗里达州一名女子指控Character聊天机器人导致其14岁儿子自杀。【原文：Alphabet's Google and artificial-intelligence startup Character.AI have agreed to settle a lawsuit from a Florida woman who alleged a Character chatbot led to the suicide of her 14-year-old son, according to a Wednesday court filing.】
